title: Maruru (Offerings of Gratitude), from the Noa Noa Suite

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of end-grain boxwood block, with a commercially prepared gray ground, selectively inked in black printing ink.

medium_display: End-grain boxwood block, with a commercially prepared gray ground, selectively inked in black printing ink
credit_line: Gift of the Print and Drawing Club
publication_history:
Marcel Guérin, L’oeuvre gravé de Gauguin (H. Floury, 1927; Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1980), cat. 24.

Musée du Luxembourg, Gauguin: Sculpteur et graveur, exh. cat. (Musée du Luxembourg, 1928), p. 13, cat. 101.

Stedelijk Museum, Vincent van Gogh en zijn ijdgenooten, exh. cat. (G. van Dorssen, 1930), p. 48, no. 186.

Wildenstein & Co., A Loan Exhibition of Paul Gauguin, for the Benefit of the New York Infirmary, with an essay by Raymond Cogniat (Wildenstein & Co., 1946), p. 74, cat. 87.

Frederick B. Adams, Jr., Carl O. Schniewind, 1900–1957: Catalogue of the Carl O. Schniewind Memorial Exhibition of Prints and Drawings, exh. cat. (Art Institute of Chicago, 1958), cat. 54.

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), pp. 110, 114, cat. 22.

Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers, Paul Gauguin: Pages from the Pacific, exh. cat. (Auckland City Art Gallery/Art Institute of Chicago, 1995), pp. 41, 52, cat. 20 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, exhibition brochure (Art Institute of Chicago, 2003), not in cat.

Starr Figura, Gauguin: Metamorphoses, with essays by Elizabeth Childs, Hal Foster, and Erika Mosier, exh. cat. (Museum of Modern Art, New York, 2013), pp. 140, 225, cat. 90.
exhibition_history:
Paris, Musée du Luxembourg, "Gauguin: Sculpteur et Graveur," January–February, 1928, p. 13, cat. 101.

Amsterdam, Stedelijk Museum, Vincent van Gogh en zijn tijdgenooten, Sept. 6–Nov. 2, 1930, cat. 186, as De feestdag der Goden.

Brooklyn Museum, "Complete Graphic Work of Paul Gauguin," June 17-Oct 2, 1938, no exh. cat.

New York, Wildenstein and Company, "Paul Gauguin," April 3-May 4, 1946, p. 74, cat. 87.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Carl O. Schniewind: Memorial Exhibition," January 22–March 3, 1958, cat. 54.

Auckland, New Zealand, Auckland City Art Gallery, "Paul Gauguin: Pages From the Pacific," August 4-October 15, 1995, pp. 41 and 52, cat. 20 (ill.), cat. by Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific, The Edward McCormick Blair Collection," September 6, 2003-January 11, 2004.

New York, The Museum of Modern Art, "Gauguin Metamorphoses," February 25-June 9, 2014,  p. 140, 225 pl. 90, cat. by Starr Figura, et. al

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Gauguin: Artist as Alchemist",  June 25 - September 10, 2017, pp. 31, 35, 52, 212, 218, cat. 152, cat. by Gloria Groom, et. al., traveled to Paris, Réunion des musées nationaux - Grand Palais, October 9, 2017 - January 21, 2018.
provenance_text: Purchased by Pola Gauguin (1883-1961) in 1919 [acc. to Pola Gauguin in 'Galerie und Sammler']. Leicester Galleries, London (MM. Brown and Phillips) at least by 1927 (Guérin, 1927). Sold by Jean Goriany, New York, to the Art Institute, 1940.

input: Maruru (Offerings of Gratitude), from the Noa Noa Suite
